description: Mini-test and mock exam templates for ACCA FA used by Outcomeo’s AI tutor. Structural blueprints, not specific question IDs.

mini_tests.title: FA Mini Test 1 – Concepts & Double Entry
mini_tests.format: MCQ-only, mixed conceptual and simple numeric
notes_for_agent: Focus on accounting concepts, the accounting equation and simple double-entry.
Include straightforward ledger postings (e.g. cash sale, credit purchase, capital introduced).
Use simple numbers; the priority is understanding debits and credits.

mini_tests.title: FA Mini Test 2 – Adjustments & Trial Balance
notes_for_agent: Test understanding of accruals, prepayments and simple error correction.
Include questions where candidates adjust profit or closing balances.
Make sure at least a couple of questions ask which errors DO or DO NOT affect the trial balance.

mini_tests.title: FA Mini Test 3 – Financial Statements & Ratios
notes_for_agent: Use small SPL/SFP extracts and ask for missing figures or simple interpretation.
Include simple ratio questions on current ratio, gross margin or net margin.
Emphasise interpretation at an introductory FA level rather than advanced commentary.

mock_exams.title: FA Mock Exam 1 – Balanced Coverage
notes_for_agent: Mix short, focused questions with a few mini-scenarios.
Ensure that the majority of marks come from double-entry, adjustments and basic financial statements.
Provide detailed explanations in review mode, linking back to FA01–FA10 units.

mock_exams.title: FA Mock Exam 2 – Adjustments & Errors Focus
mock_exams.format: MCQ-only with heavier emphasis on year-end adjustments

sections.name: Section A – Adjustments and Trial Balance

notes_for_agent: Increase the proportion of questions where students must adjust for accruals, prepayments and basic errors.
Include several questions where the trial balance does not balance and ask for suspense account or corrected profit.
In the debrief, emphasise how adjustments flow into SPL and SFP.
